newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Pioneer shareholders asked to back plans.
newsitem.headline: Pioneer shareholders asked to back plans.

text.p: Regent Fund Management Ltd on Thursday recommended in a notice to shareholders of Pioneer Industries International Holdings to back resolutions it will propose at a special general meeting on September 10.
The resolutions call for appointment of 13 additional directors to Pioneer's board, and for a reduction to the discount of market value of shares they held in the company.
The fund manager said Pioneer share prices were trading at a 40 percent discount to its true net asset value, and the company did not give adequate disclosure in its annual 1994-1995 report.

"Regent believes that these directors will provide Pioner shareholders with the benefit of new experience in managing investments...and will aid in clarifying the asset base of the company and determine the direction that the company should take after September 10, 1996" the notice said.
